{"step_by_step_thinking": "Specific protection is a component of primary prevention that targets a type or group of diseases. It complements the goals of health promotion. To determine which option does not include specific protection under primary prevention, we need to examine each option and see if it targets a specific disease or group of diseases. A. Tab Rifampicin to those in contact with meningitis is a specific protection measure targeting meningitis. B. Health education is a health promotion activity that does not target a specific disease or condition. C. Pentavalent vaccination is a specific protection measure targeting multiple diseases. D. Wheat flour fortified with added iron is a specific protection measure targeting iron deficiency anemia. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Health education.", "answer_choice": "B"}
